medical_history.chief_complaint: Syndrome of abnormal thyroid hormone metabolism, delayed bone maturation, congenital myopathy, and impaired mental and motor coordination development.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient presented at age 12, with symptoms noted since 11 months of age, including slightly elevated TSH and abnormal thyroid hormone levels. At birth, she was small for gestational age, and additional symptoms such as hypotonia and weakness were observed early in life. Motor and intellectual milestones were delayed, with walking at age 2 and speaking at age 3. By age 9, she developed symmetrical generalized peripheral sensitive neuropathy which progressed slowly. Continued thyroid hormone level abnormalities persisted during childhood.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Hypothyroidism since 11 months of age; short stature and obesity; progressive peripheral congenital myopathy; impaired mental and motor coordination development.
medical_history.family_history: The patient has a family history of heterozygous mutations in the SBP2 gene, with the father carrying a nonsense mutation and the mother carrying a different nonsense mutation, along with 16 other asymptomatic relatives.
